meanings.definition: To smile or gesture in a silly, self-conscious, often coy manner.
meanings.sent1: She was simpering at her reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent2: The young girl was simpering at the cute puppy.
meanings.sent3: The simpering squirrel seemed to be enjoying the attention.
meanings.sent4: Her simpering expression was like a mask hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The simpering clown entertained the children with exaggerated gestures.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a silly, self-conscious, often coy smile or gesture.
meanings.sent1: He couldn't stand her simpering behavior during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The simpering actress always played the role of the innocent maiden.
meanings.sent3: The simpering cat looked adorable with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The simpering flowers in the garden added a touch of whimsy to the landscape.
meanings.sent5: Her simpering expression made her seem less approachable than she actually was.
